## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-rewriterope-cpp-/ropepiecebtreeleaf">RopePieceBTreeLeaf</a> - Directly manages up to &#39;2&#42;WidthFactor&#39; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ropepiece">RopePiece</a> nodes.

This directly represents a chunk of the string with those RopePieces concatenated. Since this is a B+Tree, all values (in this case instances of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ropepiece">RopePiece</a>) are stored in leaves like this. To make iteration over the leaves efficient, they maintain a singly linked list through the NextLeaf field. This allows the B+Tree forward iterator to be constant time for all increments.

Definition at line 134 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/rewriterope-cpp">RewriteRope.cpp</a>.

### insert() {#acf7193c4f9e38edd218457ecad2b11c8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RopePieceBTreeNode &#42; RopePieceBTreeLeaf::insert (unsigned Offset, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ropepiece">RopePiece</a> &amp; R)</>}>
insert - Insert the specified ropepiece into this tree node at the specified offset.

insert - Insert the specified <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ropepiece">RopePiece</a> into this tree node at the specified offset.

The offset is relative, so &quot;0&quot; is the start of the node.

If there is no space in this subtree for the extra piece, the extra tree node is returned and must be inserted into a parent.

### split() {#a5c8dc367b84e8104ed2e8062caa6c165}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RopePieceBTreeNode &#42; RopePieceBTreeLeaf::split (unsigned Offset)</>}>
split - Split the range containing the specified offset so that we are guaranteed that there is a place to do an insertion at the specified offset.

The offset is relative, so &quot;0&quot; is the start of the node.

If there is no space in this subtree for the extra piece, the extra tree node is returned and must be inserted into a parent.
